title: Atlantic Street Capital Targets $850 Million for New Fund; Firm made several senior hires ahead of its fundraising efforts
text:
The Los Angeles County Employees Retirement Association, a public pension system that manages $71.49 billion, committed up to $150 million to the latest fund, according to documents from the pension system.

Atlantic Street invests in lower-midmarket companies with revenues between $25 million and $150 million and earnings of $4 million to $15 million before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, according to a regulatory filing and press statements. The firm targets investments in the healthcare, consumer-discretionary, information-technology and industrial sectors.

Its recent investments include Norcross, Ga.-based Renew Digital, which provides dental-imaging equipment as well technical service and support for dental offices.

Last year, Atlantic Street acquired four companies and several add-on investments out of its prior fund Atlantic Street Capital IV LP, according to its website.

Atlantic Street was formed by Peter Shabecoff in 2006 and was joined that same year by Andrew Wilkins. The two men jointly own the firm and are co-chief executives.

Before launching the firm, Mr. Shabecoff had led a series of portfolio companies at Greenwich, Conn.-based private-equity firm North Castle Partners, according to Atlantic Street's website. Mr. Wilkins, meanwhile, had worked on the mezzanine fund team at Audax Group as well as at CIBC World Markets and Bank of AmericaSecurities, the marketing name used by the global banking and global markets divisions of Bank of America Corp., the website said.

Atlantic Street beefed up its senior team with a number of new hires ahead of its latest effort to raise money, the people familiar with the fundraising said. The hires include Chief Operating Officer Whit Williams, Chief Financial Officer Cristin Brown and partner Johnny Conklin, who will focus on deal sourcing and business development for new platforms and add-on deals.

Another new hire, partner Jay Steinle, leads the investor-relations team and previously spent more than 15 years as managing director of global fundraising for alternative-investment firm Lighthouse Investment Partners.

In a July regulatory filing, Atlantic Street said it had hired Debra Draughan to lead its fundraising efforts. Ms. Draughan is managing partner of Top Capital Advisors Inc. a placement firm that advises private-equity firms on their fundraising efforts, according to her LinkedIn page.

As of March 31, Atlantic Street managed approximately $1.4 billion of discretionary assets, according to the regulatory filing.
